answers.answer: Hi!First of all get T3, T4, and TSH done to see if your thyroid is under control. Often uncontrolled thyroid problems are the cause of tiredness and whole body ache.If this is ruled out then you need to be tested for anemia, diabetes, vita D and B12 deficiency, and hormonal imbalance due to menopause.  Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: i have been taking levothyroxin 200mg  for 4 yrs. and i have gain 60lb i am always so tired and  i am always hurting , what do i do to  feel better, tired of being so dam tired can some one help me [Please]
title: need help
